summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense counsel regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It transmits draft proposals for joint voir dire and a jury questionnaire, with a request for feedback by October 7, 2021, ahead of a court submission deadline of October 11, 2021.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, transmitting draft legal documents (voir dire and jury questionnaire) to the defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Deadline for Proposed Voir Dire and Jury Questionnaire
events.description: The court deadline for submitting joint proposed voir dire and jury questionnaire documents in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Defense Feedback Deadline
events.description: The deadline by which defense counsel is requested to return proposed changes to the draft voir dire and jury questionnaire.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated October 5, 2021, from a federal prosecutor to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
It concerns the pre-trial process of drafting joint jury selection materials (voir dire and a questionnaire).
It indicates an ongoing, collaborative legal procedure between prosecution and defense ahead of Maxwell's trial.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
